item.title: Navy names sailors still missing after Pacific plane crash
item.description: U.S. military called off search for 3 men days after C-2A Greyhound transport plane crashed southeast of Okinawa

item.title: Death toll jumps after attack on Egyptian mosque
item.description: 27 kids among hundreds killed by gunmen who attacked Sufi Muslims -- sect often targeted by ISIS -- at Friday prayers

item.title: Egypt mosque attack leaves at least 305 dead
item.description: Friday’s terror attack at a crowded mosque in Egypt left at least 305 worshipers dead and more than 100 injured. The assault was in the northern part of the troubled Sinai Peninsula. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Charlie D’Agata reports.

item.title: U.S. reverses course on closing Palestinian office in DC
item.description: The State Department says it may stay open, with restrictions

item.title: Hundreds dead after militants attack mosque in Egypt
item.description: At least 235 people were killed by bombs and bullets at a mosque in the Sinai peninsula. At least 109 were injured. The attackers were said to be Islamic militants who targeted other Muslims who don't follow their interpretation of Islam. President Trump called the massacre "horrible and cowardly." Elizabeth Palmer reports.

item.title: 11/24: CBS Evening News
item.description: At least 235 people were killed by bombs and bullets at a mosque in the Sinai peninsula. At least 109 were injured; When the lunch bell rings at Boca Raton High School in Florida, 3,400 kids spill into the courtyard and split into their social groups. But at this school and at schools across the country, someone always sits alone. That's why Denis Estimon, a Haitian immigrant and student at Boca High, started a club called "We Dine Together."

item.title: Militant with $10M bounty on his head freed from house arrest
item.description: Authorities release U.S.-wanted militant who allegedly founded banned group linked to terror attack

item.title: Tiger shot and killed after escaping from Paris circus
item.description: Police said that the big cat was "neutralized" by a staff member from the circus near a bridge

item.title: Busy London station evacuated amid reports of shots fired
item.description: Police descend on shopping district after receiving multiple reports of shots fired; no casualties located

item.title: Relatives of sailors missing on submarine heartbroken and angry
item.description: An international agency said it detected an underwater sound that's consistent with an explosion near the sub's last-known position

item.title: San Francisco's "sex slave" statue decision stirs controversy
item.description: City gives formal city property status to a statue commemorating women who worked in military-backed brothels for Japanese troops during World War II

item.title: "60 Minutes" visits Eigg, craggy isle off Scotland
item.description: With our busy lives in a fast-paced world, it's easy to dream of an escape from it all. For about a hundred people, that place is the isle of Eigg in the north Atlantic, off the coast of Scotland. The island's residents prefer to live far from modern life on the U.K. mainland. "60 Minutes" correspondent Steve Kroft visited the island to see the appeal and the unparalleled natural beauty. Watch the full report Sunday, Nov. 26 on "60 Minutes."

item.title: At least 235 killed in Egypt mosque attack
item.description: Militants set off explosives and spray worshippers with gunfire in the deadliest ever attack by Islamic extremists in Egypt

item.title: Search for Navy sailors in cargo plane crash called off
item.description: The U.S. Navy called off the search for three sailors missing in the western Pacific. They were on a cargo plane that crashed Wednesday, trying to reach an American aircraft carrier south of Japan. Ben Tracy reports.

item.title: Relatives angry over missing Argentine submarine's apparent explosion
item.description: An ominous new development in the search for a missing Argentine submarine raises concerns it may have plunged off the continental shelf. An international agency said it detected an underwater sound that's consistent with an explosion near the sub's last known position in the south Atlantic. It has a crew of 44 sailors. Adriana Diaz reports.

item.title: 8 N. Korean men say they washed ashore in Japan
item.description: Japanese media say investigators believe men were fishing and wish to return home, but they could still be in trouble

item.title: Zimbabwe's 1st post-Mugabe leader sworn in
item.description: Emmerson Mnangagwa -- the "Crocodile" -- was a key Mugabe confidant for decades, until he was sacked earlier this month as vice president

item.title: S. Dakota politician, brother-in-law drown on kayak trip
item.description: Republican State Rep. Craig Tieszen was at daughter's wedding on South Pacific island chain when "tragedy at sea" struck

item.title: Court doubles Oscar Pistorius' prison sentence
item.description: South Africa's Supreme Court of Appeal rules previous 6-year sentence too lenient for murder of Pistorius' girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp

item.title: Zimbabwe's new president set to be sworn in
item.description: Robert Mugabe, 93, and his wife have not been seen in public since Saturday, and their whereabouts are unknown
